t: Proverbs 3
Trust in the Lord with All Your Heart
My*pn son, do not forget my teaching, but*ld let your heart keep my commandments,
for*ln length of days and years of life and*ld peace they will add to you.
Let*pn not steadfast love and faithfulness forsake you; bind*ld them around your neck; write*ld them on the tablet of your heart.
So*ln you will find favor and good success in*ld the sight of God and man.
Trust*pn in the Lord*s with all your heart, and*ld do not lean on your own understanding.
In*ln all your ways acknowledge him, and*ld he will make straight your paths.
Be*ln not wise in your own eyes; fear*ld the Lord,*s and turn away from evil.
It*ln will be healing to your flesh and*ld refreshment to your bones.
Honor*pn the Lord*s with your wealth and*ld with the firstfruits of all your produce;
then*ln your barns will be filled with plenty, and*ld your vats will be bursting with wine.
My*pn son, do not despise the Lord’s*s discipline or*ld be weary of his reproof,
for*ln the Lord*s reproves him whom he loves, as*ld a father the son in whom he delights.
Blessed Is the One Who Finds Wisdom
Blessed*pn is the one who finds wisdom, and*ld the one who gets understanding,
for*ln the gain from her is better than gain from silver and*ld her profit better than gold.
She*ln is more precious than jewels, and*ld nothing you desire can compare with her.
Long*ln life is in her right hand; in*ld her left hand are riches and honor.
Her*ln ways are ways of pleasantness, and*ld all her paths are peace.
She*ln is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her; those*ld who hold her fast are called blessed.
The*pn Lord*s by wisdom founded the earth; by*ld understanding he established the heavens;
by*ln his knowledge the deeps broke open, and*ld the clouds drop down the dew.
My*pn son, do not lose sight of these— keep*ld sound wisdom and discretion,
and*ln they will be life for your soul and*ld adornment for your neck.
Then*ln you will walk on your way securely, and*ld your foot will not stumble.
If*ln you lie down, you will not be afraid; when*ld you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
Do*ln not be afraid of sudden terror or*ld of the ruin of the wicked, when it comes,
for*ln the Lord*s will be your confidence and*ld will keep your foot from being caught.
Do*ln not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when*ld it is in your power to do it.
Do*pn not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again, tomorrow*ld I will give it”— when you have it with you.
Do*ln not plan evil against your neighbor, who*ld dwells trustingly beside you.
Do*ln not contend with a man for no reason, when*ld he has done you no harm.
Do*ln not envy a man of violence and*ld do not choose any of his ways,
for*ln the devious person is an abomination to the Lord,*s but*ld the upright are in his confidence.
The*ln Lord’s*s curse is on the house of the wicked, but*ld he blesses the dwelling of the righteous.
Toward*ln the scorners he is scornful, but*ld to the humble he gives favor.
The*ln wise will inherit honor, but*ld fools get disgrace.
